description: Especially good for those that want an excellent Linux solution for Google Drive (although not limited to Google Drive). This app is the front end to the robust Rclone backup which has powerful command line features. This is good for us wanting a GUI front end to Rclone.

I enjoy discovering what rclone can do. It should be very beneficil to me. 
 However, Ubuntu provides version 1.8, while at startup the 
program tells me version 1.52 is ready and available.
I can understand Ubuntu being 2 or even 3 revisions behind.
But Fourty Four (44, 11 x 4) versions back? What gives?
I will douwnload version 1.52 and update this review with my 
findings. In the meantime, one star for being here, one star for the idea, 
and one star for not crashing at startup.
really thought that I could for i in {1..5}; do rclone copy (...) & done and have a gui for viewing them go, but nooooooooo....

Linux needs more simple. I would say 4/5 stars because you still need CLI for the actual setup of the drives and you can only do them one by one (though this is rclone itself i guess not the browser)

If a GUI existed for a complete newbie to setup a drive without entering CLI at all i would up this to 5/5
The world need try it. Easy to use.

J'apprécie le fait que je l'interface graphique rend les taches plus faciles à faire. Il ne reste que la possibilité d'ouvrir les fichiers sur à partir de la fenêtre de Rclone Browser au lieu de naviguer vers dossier hôte de OneDrive.
